description.narrative: 150,000 excluded children and adolescents have access to formal or alternative pathways to primary education., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the GER for primary school has increased by 9 per cent, ensuring safe, equitable and quality education, with improved learning outcomes for learners at pre-primary, primary and secondary levels, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and vulnerable children, especially girls, populations and geographic areas.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 150,000 excluded children and adolescents have access to formal or alternative pathways to primary education.

description.narrative: 36,757 children and adolescents (44% girls) were reached through the Education Programme's support to 96 Alternative Basic Education centres in the Federal Government of Somalia (FGS) and through the ongoing provision of educational scholarships for 2,650 vulnerable children (50% or 1,325 female) in Puntland State. A combination of formal as well as alternative pathways to primary education was a key factor in reducing the number of excluded children and adolescents from primary education. The fundamental weaknesses of ineffective policy planning, standards-setting, and financing in the sector must be urgently tackled to sustain current enrolment and to increase it. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
